name: Lesser White-fronted Goose
description: It has an overall gray-brown coloration with a white underbelly. Distinctive features include a yellow eye-ring, white forehead, and a short, bright pink beak.
spread_note: It forms three subpopulations. Geese breeding in European Russia and Central Asia winter by the Black Sea; the East Asian population breeds in eastern Siberia and winters in China; a small European population breeds in Norway and the Kola Peninsula, wintering in Turkey and Greece.
food_note: Green parts of grasses and other herbs and shrubs, mainly seeds during migration
reproduction: Females lay 4–8 eggs; incubation lasts 25–28 days.
attractions: It ventures far from water to forage, including into forests or mountain slopes.
projects_note: Due to intensive hunting in the Asian part of its range, its population declined by nearly half between 1998 and 2008. It is therefore listed as vulnerable on the IUCN Red List.
breeding: We have kept them at least since 1983.
